title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.41 Part 2 | 27-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Jai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udeerayet
In this session we will continue to discuss
from the four principles of the Bhagavad Gita.
In the previous session we had discussed the first half of the purport and in this session we will discuss the second half of the purport.
Here is a little technical description of how Yudhishthira Maharaj actually cut off all the
attachments material attachments when he was preparing to actually go back home
back to Godhead after relinquishing all his responsibilities by handing them over
to his grandson and Krishna's great grandson. So it was already explained just
to refresh your memory of that time. So it was already explained just to refresh your memory of that time.

and we started to learn a little bit more about the reverse itself.

Mrityav Apanam Sotsargaam Tam Panchatve Hi Ajo Havit

to the Lord. In this way, the senses, one is able to actually become free from the material senses. This is the outermost layer of covering, this gross bodily covering.
Then, actually, the activities of the mind cannot be stopped, for they are the reflection of the eternal soul.
Actually, the material mind, we want to stop all material thinking, but that does not mean totally stop all activities of this mind.
The present mind that we have. No. Because, it is the desire of the soul that is expressed through the mind.
The activities of the soul are expressed through the material mind.
So, therefore, Prabhupada says, the activities of the mind are reflection of the eternal soul.
I am spirit.
I am soul. I am eternal soul.
So, the soul in the material world is reflected through the mind.
Therefore, what has to be done is, the activities of the mind can be changed from matter to devotional service.
So, there is a need to engage the mind differently.
That's all.
So, the material color of the mind is changed when one washes it from contaminations of life breathing,
and thereby frees it from the contamination of repeated births and deaths.
If you are having idea of a continuing material existence,
then, when this body, the term of life,
in this body is over,
if I have to continue material existence,
I have to get another material body.
That's called repetition of birth and death.
So,
to purify this mind
means to stop this repetition of birth and death.
That means to end
all activities of the mind.
All plans for continuing material existence or rather, change material existence to spiritual existence.
Now, Srila Prabhupada says, one has to situate oneself in pure spiritual life.
Therefore, we should practice.
Therefore, we should practice.
Begin with spiritual life.
Let's say, just chant 108 times Hare Krishna every day.
It just takes about 10 minutes.
So, out of 24 hours in a day,
10 minutes at least, perform spiritual activity,
whereby 10 minutes you are not engaging the mind in material activity.
The mind becomes engaged in spiritual activity.
So, this is a very important point.
And gradually go on increasing the spiritual activity,
thereby reducing the engagement of the mind in material activities.
And by the time you retire from all your material responsibilities,
you should have completely changed all your engagements of the mind from material to spiritual.
It means go on increasing your spiritual activities
by which you engage the mind in spiritual life.
Therefore, the program of Sadhana Bhakti
is how to increase the activities that we perform
through the body, words and mind,
more and more in devotional service.
So, there are 64 principles of Sadhana Bhakti,
different varieties of engagement in spiritual life.
Why 64? Why so many?
Because in different ways,
we are engaging our body, words and mind in material activities.
So, if we have to spiritualize our engagement of the mind,
we have to find different varieties
of engagement for the mind through the body,
through the words and through the mind.
So, therefore, there are 64 activities.
And one by one by one,
we should start adding those activities to our daily routine.
Just like chanting Hare Krishna,
then singing Hare Krishna,
then offering food to Krishna,
either a picture of Krishna or a deity of Krishna,
accepting Prasadam after offering food,
then reading the spiritual literature,
Bhagavad Gita, Bhagavatam,
hearing about Krishna's pastimes,
like that.
So many different engagements are possible
and increase the engagements.
Now, how do the engagements become more and more?
When you associate with devotees
who are already engaged in such spiritual activities,
especially the devotees
who are dedicated for Krishna Consciousness.
Throughout the day,
they are engaged in varieties of activities
simply meant for engaging the mind in Krishna Consciousness.
So, you also associate,
you learn,
you become interested,
you become attracted.
You also get some practical tips
about how to manage your material duties,
material responsibilities
while minimizing the material engagement of the mind.
You learn from the devotees.
And in this way,
the mind becomes purified.
When the mind is purified,
and that means the mind is constantly engaged
in the service of the Lotus Feet of the Lord,
then at the time of death,
the mind will not produce another material body,
but the mind will actually enable the soul
to go back home, back to God.
I'll stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
